alert.note: Alert for Idaho (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued November 27 at 1:58PM MST until November 27 at 2:45PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: The National Weather Service in Missoula has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... West central Idaho County in central Idaho... * Until 145 PM PST. * At 1257 PM PST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Craigmont, or 18 miles west of Kamiah, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Flash freeze on roads. Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood and Ferdinand. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Wet roadways will quickly freeze. Black ice will cause roads, bridges, and overpasses to become slick and dangerous. Slow down and be prepared for a sudden loss of traction. Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.
